member_organisations:
The Association of the Primary Food Processors of the EU (PFP) is composed of : 
Starch Europe, European Starch Industry 
CEFS, European Committee of Sugar Manufacturers 
ECA, European Cocoa Association 
EFM, European Flour Milling Association 
EUVEPRO, European Vegetable Protein Federation 
FEDIOL, European Vegetable Oil and Proteinmeal Industry
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Customs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action
inter_groups: EP Intergroup “Climate Change, Biodiversity & Sustainable Development” (EUBA  launch of the Intergroup)
eu_initiatives:
- Country of origin labelling (as part of FIC implementation) 
- CAP reform 
- Industrial policy; competitiveness 
- Biobased economy 
- Sustainability in food production; SCP Roundtable; PEF-pilots 
- Trade negotiations, bilateral and multilateral
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: High Level Forum for a Better Functioning Food Supply Chain#E03337#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3337#Member#C#Advisory Group on the Food Chain and Animal and Plant Health#E00860#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=860#Member#C#Animal Health Advisory Committee
membership:
PFP does not belong to any other federation but cooperates on an ad hoc basis with other organisations such as COPA-COGECA, FDE, COCERAL or FEFAC, with a view to strengthen the approaches and positions taken in the field of food and feed safety and industry supply. 
PFP has joined the European Bioeconomy Alliance (EuBA) in 2014.
